title: Linux pwunconv Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the pwunconv command in Linux, which secures user passwords by moving them from the shadow file to the password file. Learn practical scenarios for using pwunconv to manage user permissions and enhance system security.

meta.title: Linux pwunconv Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the pwunconv command in Linux, which secures user passwords by moving them from the shadow file to the password file. Learn practical scenarios for using pwunconv to manage user permissions and enhance system security.
meta.keywords: Linux, pwunconv, user management, password security, permission management, system administration

verify.name: Verify the passwords have been moved to /etc/passwd
verify.hint: The passwords have not been moved to the /etc/passwd file. Please run the `pwunconv` command again.

verify.name: Verify the passwords have been moved back to /etc/shadow
verify.hint: The passwords have not been moved back to the /etc/shadow file. Please run the `pwconv` command again.

verify.name: Verify the passwords are still in /etc/shadow
verify.hint: The passwords are not in the /etc/shadow file. Please run the `pwconv` command to move the passwords back to the /etc/shadow file.
